titleStmt.title: The elegy on that reverend presbyter Mr. William Jenkins, who finisht his obstinacy the 19th. of January in the goal of Newgate, where are above fourscore dissenters, of almost as many of the several scattered churches remaining. In a dialogue between despair and comfort: in imitation of a former elegy, in dialogue between faith and sense. Seiz'd and supprest by authority.

The elegy on that reverend presbyter Mr. William Jenkins, who finisht his obstinacy the 19th. of January in the goal of Newgate, where are above fourscore dissenters, of almost as many of the several scattered churches remaining. In a dialogue between despair and comfort: in imitation of a former elegy, in dialogue between faith and sense. Seiz'd and supprest by authority.

publicationStmt.publisher: Sold by Walter Davis in Amen-Corner,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Prisons accurst! and more accursed law! ..."
A reply to: An elegy on that reverend and learned minister of the Gospel, Mr. William Jenkins.
Identified as Wing E434 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700" reel 1355.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
